hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on xx

We’ll be doing xx ex. meditation followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

content.text: Take a close look at your life as it has evolved up until now. This exercise can bring up strong emotions. That is alright and all part of the exercise. If you need to, you can take a break at any time.

hostNotes.text:
Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. 

> Push play to start the audio exercise

Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

What can you learn from this?

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

content.heading: What can you learn from this?

hostNotes.text:
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

content.heading: What can you learn from this?

hostNotes.text:
Well done. If you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

xx mission description

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text:
Well done for completing the life exploration. To actively reflect on past events sometimes help us look at the current circumstances in a different light. 

Sometimes the darker periods are the ones where we have learned the most. And sometimes the toughest challenges are followed by a time of deep connection and meaning. Whatever is true for you, we encourage you to continue the conversation with someone close to you.

en.name: PsyPal Life exploration

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

da.description: Lav en oversigt over dit livsforløb frem til nu, og lær af dine egne tidligere erfaringer. Du skal bruge pen og papir for at gennemføre denne øvelse.
da.name: PsyPal Livsrefleksion

hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on xx

We’ll be doing xx ex. meditation followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

content.text: Kast et nærmere blik på dit liv, som det har udfoldet sig frem til nu. Denne øvelse kan frembringe stærke følelser. Det er helt i orden og er en del af øvelsen. Hvis du har brug for det kan du altid tage en pause undervejs.

hostNotes.text:
Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. 

> Push play to start the audio exercise

content.heading: Hvad kan du lære af dette?

hostNotes.text:
Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

What can you learn from this?

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

content.heading: Hvad kan du lære af dette?

hostNotes.text:
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

Well done. If you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

xx mission description

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text:
Godt klaret at gennemføre livsrefleksionen! Nogle gange kan det at reflektere over tidligere begivenheder hjælpe os med at se vores nuværende omstændigheder i et nyt lys.

Nogle gange er de mørkeste perioder af vores liv også de mest lærerige. Og nogle gange er det de hårdeste udfordringer, der baner vejen for en tid fyldt med mening og dyb forbindelse. Uanset hvad der er tilfældet for dig, opfordrer vi dig til at fortsætte samtalen med en, der står dig nær.

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

cs.description: Vytvořte přehled vašeho dosavadního života a poučte se z minulých zkušeností. K dokončení tohoto cvičení budete potřebovat pero a papír.
cs.name: PsyPal Průzkum života

content.text: Podívejte se zblízka na svůj život, jak se vyvíjel až do současnosti. Toto cvičení může vyvolat silné emoce. To je v pořádku a je to součástí cvičení. Pokud potřebujete, můžete si kdykoli udělat přestávku.

content.heading: Co se z toho můžete naučit?
Co se z toho můžete naučit?

content.text:
Výborně, že jste dokončili cvičení zaměřené naprůzkum vašeho života. Aktivní reflexe minulých událostí nám někdy pomáhá vidět současnou situaci v jiném světle.

Někdy jsou nejtemnější období ta, ve kterých jsme se naučili nejvíce. A někdy po nejtěžších výzvách následuje období hlubokého spojení a smyslu. Ať už to platí nebo neplatí také pro vás, doporučujeme pokračovat v rozhovoru s někým vám blízkým.

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

nl.description: Maak een overzicht van je leven tot nu toe en leer van je eigen ervaringen uit het verleden. Je hebt pen en papier nodig om deze oefening te voltooien.
nl.name: PsyPal Levensverkenning

hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on xx

We’ll be doing xx ex. meditation followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

content.text: Neem een goede kijk op je leven zoals het zich tot nu toe heeft ontwikkeld. Deze oefening kan sterke emoties oproepen. Dat is oké en maakt deel uit van de oefening. Als je het nodig hebt, kun je op elk moment een pauze nemen.

hostNotes.text:
Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. 

> Push play to start the audio exercise

Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

What can you learn from this?

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

Well done. If you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

xx mission description

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text:
Goed gedaan met het voltooien van de levensverkenning. Actief reflecteren op gebeurtenissen uit het verleden helpt ons soms om de huidige omstandigheden in een ander licht te zien.

Soms zijn de donkerste periodes degene waarvan we het meest hebben geleerd. En soms worden de moeilijkste uitdagingen gevolgd door een tijd van diepe verbondenheid en betekenis. Wat voor jou ook waar is, we moedigen je aan om het gesprek voort te zetten met iemand die dicht bij je staat.

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go
